text: highest-fidelity raw MLB data available statsapi.mlb.com baseballsavant.mlb.com, minor league data available APIs well. package provides functions query APIs, returning data collection well-factored tables (opposed returning single table). Additionally, package offers functions estimate base-run expectancy; estimate count values; recover full estimated quadratic trajectory pitch pitch tracking data.

title: Query {statsapi,baseballsavant}.mlb.com and fit fundamental sabermetric models
Query {statsapi,baseballsavant}.mlb.com and fit fundamental sabermetric models
text: important data available statsapi.mlb.com. function returns four tables: game, event, pitch play. - game table holds game-level information, teams, venue date. - event table holds plate-appearance-level information, base-state, players outcome. - pitch table holds pitch-level information, pitch outcomes, pitch tracking batted ball tracking. - play table similar pitch table except also includes data regarding pre-/post-base--state, including pickoff attempts stolen base attempts (tracking data). unique Statcast data available statsapi.mlb.com, pitch spin swing tracking. data, turn baseballsavant.mlb.com. function returns pitch-level data can joined pitch table statsapi.mlb.com using columns game_id, year, event_index pitch_number.
code: # Typically takes about 5 seconds for a single game data_statsapi <- sabRmetrics::download_statsapi(   start_date = "2024-07-01",   end_date = "2024-07-01" )  # You can also run this function with parallel computation if you want to download more games #cluster <- parallel::makeCluster(parallel::detectCores()) #data_statsapi <- sabRmetrics::download_statsapi( #  start_date = "2024-01-01", #  end_date = "2024-12-31", #  cl = cluster #) #parallel::stopCluster(cluster) # Typically takes about 30 seconds for the first query of a single game but drastically speeds # up for subsequent queries of the same game because the API caches the results of the query data_baseballsavant <- sabRmetrics::download_baseballsavant(   start_date = "2024-07-01",   end_date = "2024-07-01" )  # You can also run this function with parallel computation if you want to download more games #cluster <- parallel::makeCluster(parallel::detectCores()) #data_statsapi <- sabRmetrics::download_baseballsavant( #  start_date = "2024-01-01", #  end_date = "2024-12-31", #  cl = cluster #) #parallel::stopCluster(cluster)

title: Query {statsapi,baseballsavant}.mlb.com and fit fundamental sabermetric models
text: Possibly fundamental model sabermetrics base-run expectancy. function fits Markov model assuming state specified bases occupied number outs, using empirical transition probabilities states. refinement base-run expectancy include ball-strike count state. Rather expanding Markov state include count, function calculates expected change base-run expectancy result plate appearance, conditional plate appearance passing specified count. interpret run value count, allows us measure outcomes individual pitches run scale. Lastly, working pitch tracking data, fundamentally useful step recreate full estimated quadratic trajectory pitch. vast majority well-known pitch tracking metrics (e.g. horizontal/vertical break, plate location, approach angle) derived estimated quadratic trajectory. function get_quadratic_coef calculates coefficients required reproduce full trajectory data provided either statsapi.mlb.com baseballsavant.mlb.com. function get_trackman_metrics shows derive many well-known pitch tracking metrics quadratic coefficients.
code: # You probably want at least one full season of data for this, maybe as many as three seasons base_out_run_exp <- sabRmetrics::estimate_base_out_run_exp(event = data_statsapi$event) # You probably want at least one full season of data for this, maybe as many as three seasons count_value <- sabRmetrics::estimate_count_value(   play = data_datsapi$play,   event = data_stastapi$event,   base_out_run_exp = base_out_run_exp ) pitch_statsapi <- data_statsapi$pitch |>   sabRmetrics::get_quadratic_coef(source = "statsapi") |>   sabRmetrics::get_trackman_metrics()  pitch_baseballsavant <- data_baseballsavant |>   sabRmetrics::get_quadratic_coef(source = "baseballsavant") |>   sabRmetrics::get_trackman_metrics()
